en: Let's try something.
I have to go to sleep.

Muiriel is 20 now.
The password is "Muiriel".
I will be back soon.
I'm at a loss for words.
This is never going to end.

That was an evil bunny.
I was in the mountains.
Is it a recent picture?
I don't know if I have the time.
Education in this world disappoints me.
You're in better shape than I am.
You are in my way.

en: I brought you a little something.
This will cost €30.
I make €100 a day.
I may give up soon and just nap instead.
ko: 조만간 포기하고 그냥 낮잠이나 잘지도 몰라.

en: It's because you don't want to be alone.
ko: 네가 혼자 있기 싫어서 그런 거야.

en: That won't happen.
Sometimes he can be a strange guy.
ko: 가끔 걔 좀 이상한 애 같아.

en: I'll do my best not to disturb your studying.
ko: 공부 방해 안 하게 최선을 다할게.

en: I can only wonder if this is the same for everyone else.
ko: 다른 사람들도 다 똑같은지 궁금할 뿐이야.

en: I suppose it's different when you think about it over the long term.
ko: 장기적으로 생각하면 좀 다를 것 같아.

en: You should sleep.
I'm going to go.

en: If the world weren't in the shape it is now, I could trust anyone.
ko: 세상이 이 모양만 아니었어도 아무나 믿었을 거야.

en: It is unfortunately true.
Most people think I'm crazy.
No I'm not; you are!
That's MY line!
He's kicking me!
Are you sure?
Then there is a problem...
Oh, there's a butterfly!
Hurry up.
It doesn't surprise me.
For some reason I feel more alive at night.
It depends on the context.
Are you freaking kidding me?!
That's the stupidest thing I've ever said.

en: I don't want to be lame; I want to be cool!!
ko: 찌질한 건 싫어, 멋있어지고 싶단 말이야!!

en: When I grow up, I want to be a king.
America is a lovely place to be, if you are here to earn money.
ko: 돈 벌러 온 거라면 미국은 참 살기 좋은 곳이야.

en: I'm so fat.
So what?
I'm gonna shoot him.
I'm just saying!
That was probably what influenced their decision.
ko: 아마 그게 걔네 결정에 영향을 줬을 거야.

en: I've always wondered what it'd be like to have siblings.
ko: 형제나 남매가 있으면 어떨지 항상 궁금했어.

en: This is what I would have said.
It would take forever for me to explain everything.
That's because you're a girl.
Sometimes I can't help showing emotions.
ko: 가끔은 감정이 그냥 다 드러나 버려.

en: It's a word I'd like to find a substitute for.
It would be something I'd have to program.
ko: 그건 내가 프로그래밍해야 하는 걸 거야.

en: I don't intend to be selfish.
Let's consider the worst that could happen.
How many close friends do you have?
I may be antisocial, but it doesn't mean I don't talk to people.
ko: 내가 비사교적일지는 몰라도 사람하고 대화는 해.

en: This is always the way it has been.
I think it is best not to be impolite.
ko: 무례하게 굴지 않는 게 제일 좋은 것 같아.

en: One can always find time.
I'd be unhappy, but I wouldn't kill myself.
Back in high school, I got up at 6 a.m. every morning.
When I woke up, I was sad.
That is somewhat explained at the end.
ko: 그건 마지막에 어느 정도 설명이 돼.

en: I thought you liked to learn new things.
ko: 너 새로운 거 배우는 거 좋아하는 줄 알았는데.

en: Most people write about their daily life.
If I could send you a marshmallow, Trang, I would.
ko: 트랑, 너한테 마시멜로를 보낼 수만 있다면 보냈을 거야.

en: In order to do that, you have to take risks.
Every person who is alone is alone because they are afraid of others.
ko: 혼자인 사람들은 다 남을 두려워해서 혼자인 거야.

en: Why do you ask?
I am not an artist. I never had the knack for it.
ko: 난 예술가는 아니야. 그런 쪽엔 재능이 전혀 없거든.

en: I can't tell her now. It's not that simple anymore.
ko: 지금은 걔한테 말 못 해. 이제 그렇게 간단한 문제가 아니거든.

en: Whenever I find something I like, it's too expensive.
ko: 마음에 드는 걸 찾을 때마다 너무 비싸더라.

en: How long did you stay?

Innocence is a beautiful thing.
Humans were never meant to live forever.

en: I think I have a theory about that.
That is intriguing.
You are saying you intentionally hide your good looks?
ko: 그러니까 잘생긴 외모를 일부러 숨긴다는 거야?

en: I do not have an account in these forums.
If anyone was to ask what the point of the story is, I really don't know.
ko: 누가 이 이야기의 요점이 뭐냐고 물어봐도 난 진짜 모르겠어.

en: I didn't know where it came from.
I think my living with you has influenced your way of living.
ko: 내가 너랑 같이 사는 게 네 생활 방식에 영향을 준 것 같아.

en: This is not important.

ko: 걔가 그게 어떻게 가능하냐고 묻고 있어.

en: You're just running away from life's problems.
ko: 넌 그냥 인생의 문제들로부터 도망치고 있는 거야.

en: If you look at the lyrics, they don't really mean much.
ko: 가사 보면 딱히 별 의미 없어.

en: There's a problem there that you don't see.

en: You can do it.

ko: 우리 물리 선생님은 내가 수업 빼먹어도 신경 안 써.

en: I wish I could go to Japan.

ko: 그러고 나서 나왔는데, 걔네 집에 가방 두고 온 게 생각나더라고.

en: I won't ask you anything else today.
ko: 오늘은 더 이상 아무것도 안 물어볼게.

en: There are many words that I don't understand.

ko: 나보다 훨씬 많이 아는 수학자들이 자기 생각을 명확하게 표현 못 하는 건 별로야.

en: I need to ask you a silly question.

ko: 내가 언젠가 위키피디아에서 '비아그라'를 찾아보게 될 줄은 몰랐어.

en: Can it be phrased in another way?

en: It's not something anyone can do.

ko: 다들 너 만나고 싶어 해. 너 유명하잖아!

en: What keeps you up so late?
ko: 왜 이렇게 늦게까지 안 자고 있어?

en: Stop it! You're making her feel uncomfortable!

Tomorrow, he will land on the moon.

en: It would take me too much time to explain to you why it's not going to work.

ko: 나 진짜 바보인가 봐... 나도 잘 모르는 걸 너한테 설명하려고 하고 있네.

ko: 성적에 더 신경 쓰고 싶은데, 어느 순간부터 성적이 별로 안 중요하다고 생각하게 된 것 같아.

en: "A rolling stone gathers no moss" is a proverb.

"When will you be back?" "It all depends on the weather."

"What's going on in the cave? I'm curious." "I have no idea."
ko: “동굴에서 무슨 일이 일어나는 거지? 궁금해.” “전혀 모르겠어.”

en: We must learn to live together as brothers, or we will perish together as fools.
ko: 우리는 형제처럼 함께 사는 법을 배워야 해, 안 그러면 다 같이 바보처럼 망할 거야.

en: Uh... How's that working?
"To tell you the truth, I am scared of heights." "You are a coward!"
"Trust me," he said.
"This is what I was looking for!" he exclaimed.
ko: “이게 바로 내가 찾던 거야!” 그가 외쳤어.

en: "This looks pretty interesting," Hiroshi says.

ko: 그들의 소통 방식은 생각보다 훨씬 복잡할지도 몰라.

en: "The phone is ringing." "I'll get it."
"That's very nice of you," Willie answered.
"Thank you for helping me." "Don't mention it."
Someday I'll run like the wind.
"She likes music." "So do I."
Please don't cry.
Let me know if there is anything I can do.
ko: 내가 도와줄 수 있는 게 있으면 말해줘.

en: It may be that the happiness awaiting us is not at all the sort of happiness we would want.
ko: 우리를 기다리는 행복이 우리가 원하던 그런 게 아닐지도 몰라.

en: It is up to you to decide whether we will go there or not.
Class doesn't begin until eight-thirty.
I want a boat that will take me far away from here.
ko: 날 여기서 멀리 데려다줄 배가 있었으면 좋겠어.

en: "I feel like playing cards." "So do I."

ko: “우리 어디선가 본 적 있지 않아요?” 학생이 물었어.

en: A Japanese would never do such a thing.
ko: 일본 사람이라면 절대 그런 짓은 안 할 거야.

en: Allen is a poet.
The archer killed the deer.
Communism will never be reached in my lifetime.
ko: 내가 살아있는 동안 공산주의가 실현될 일은 없을 거야.

en: Rye was called the grain of poverty.
If you see a mistake, then please correct it.
Place the deck of cards on the oaken table.
ko: 카드 덱을 오크 나무 탁자 위에 놔둬.

en: The Germans are very crafty.
If you don't eat, you die.

Why don't we go home?
I'm sorry, I can't stay long.
ko: 미안, 오래는 못 있을 것 같아.

en: Ten years is a long time to wait.
"Why aren't you going?" "Because I don't want to."
One million people lost their lives in the war.

ko: 90살 넘게 사는 건 전혀 드문 일이 아니야.

en: First, I'm going to do an outline of my new website.
ko: 먼저 새 웹사이트 개요부터 짤 거야.

en: Democracy is the worst form of government, except all the others that have been tried.
ko: 민주주의는 최악의 정부 형태야, 여태껏 시도된 다른 것들을 제외하면 말이지.

en: When you're beginning to look like the photo in your passport, you should go on a holiday.
ko: 여권 사진이랑 비슷해 보이기 시작하면, 휴가 가야 할 때야.

en: It wasn't me, commissioner!
Oh, my white pants! And they were new.
ko: 아, 내 흰 바지! 새 거였는데.

en: With so many people around he naturally became a bit nervous.
ko: 주변에 사람이 너무 많으니까 걔도 당연히 좀 긴장하더라고.

en: When I left the train station, I saw a man.
You're an angel!

Well, the night is quite long, isn't it?
You're lucky because he didn't bite you.
Did you miss me?
Are they all the same?
Thank you very much!
Where are the eggs, please?
I'll take him.
It's a surprise.
That's a good idea!
Round trip? Only one-way.
It's a pity when somebody dies.
ko: 누가 죽는다는 건 참 안타까운 일이야.

en: Damn! It's not bad!
Pull into shape after washing.
Wash before first wearing.
Don't open before the train stops.

ko: 유리 집에 사는 사람은 돌을 던지면 안 돼.

en: They say love is blind.

ko: 수학은 사랑 같은 거야. 아이디어는 단순하지만 복잡해질 수 있거든.

en: The only useful answers are those that raise new questions.
ko: 유용한 대답은 새로운 질문을 던지게 하는 것들뿐이야.

en: To have doubts about oneself is the first sign of intelligence.
ko: 자신을 의심하는 게 지능이 있다는 첫 번째 신호야.

en: Poor is not the one who has too little, but the one who wants too much.
ko: 가난한 사람은 적게 가진 사람이 아니라, 너무 많이 원하는 사람이야.

en: Seeing that you're not surprised, I think you must have known.
ko: 안 놀라는 거 보니까 이미 알고 있었나 보네.

en: How long does it take to get to the station?

ko: 이건 내 미국 여행의 좋은 기념품이 될 거야.

en: Excuse me; allow me to point out three errors in the above article.

en: It is difficult to keep up a conversation with someone who only says "yes" and "no".
ko: "응", "아니"라고만 하는 사람이랑 대화를 이어가는 건 힘들어.

en: Do you speak Italian?

en: It is said that "Hamlet" is the most interesting play ever written.
ko: "햄릿"이 지금까지 쓰인 연극 중에 제일 재밌대.

en: May I ask a question?

It's quite difficult to master French in 2 or 3 years.
ko: 2, 3년 안에 프랑스어를 마스터하는 건 꽤 어려워.

en: It's impossible for me to explain it to you.
I don't want to spend the rest of my life regretting it.
ko: 남은 인생을 후회하면서 보내고 싶지 않아.

en: It would be fun to see how things change over the years.
ko: 시간이 지나면서 어떻게 변하는지 지켜보는 것도 재밌을 거야.

en: I would never have guessed that.
Imagination affects every aspect of our lives.
ko: 상상력은 우리 삶의 모든 부분에 영향을 미쳐.

en: You'll forget about me someday.
That is rather unexpected.
I wonder how long it's going to take.
I can't live without a TV.
I couldn't have done it without you. Thank you.
ko: 너 없었으면 못 했을 거야. 고마워.

en: Nothing is achieved without effort.
ko: 노력 없이는 아무것도 이룰 수 없어.

en: Many people drift through life without a purpose.
ko: 많은 사람이 목적 없이 그냥 살아가.

en: Life without love is just totally pointless.
ko: 사랑 없는 삶은 정말 아무 의미 없어.

en: Let me know if I need to make any changes.
I think exams are ruining education.
ko: 시험이 교육을 망치고 있는 것 같아.

en: We can't sleep because of the noise.
Do you have a condom?
Do whatever he tells you.
I can walk to school in 10 minutes.
It took me more than two hours to translate a few pages of English.
ko: 영어 몇 페이지 번역하는 데 두 시간 넘게 걸렸어.

en: It is already eleven.
May I talk to Ms. Brown?
"Yes, orange juice please," says Mike.
"Ah!" is an interjection.
What do you want?
The mandatory character of schooling is rarely analyzed in the multitude of works dedicated to the study of the various ways to develop within children the desire to learn.
ko: 아이들의 학습 욕구를 키워주는 다양한 방법에 대한 수많은 연구들 중에서 학교 교육의 의무적인 성격이 분석되는 경우는 거의 없어.

en: I have a bone to pick with you.
Do you need me to give you some money?
Paris is the most beautiful city in the world.
Hey, I may have no money, but I still have my pride.
ko: 야, 내가 돈은 없어도 자존심은 있어.

en: I have a dream.
This is my friend Rachel. We went to high school together.
ko: 얘는 내 친구 레이첼이야. 우리 고등학교 같이 다녔어.

en: The cost of life increased drastically.
All that which is invented, is true.
To be surprised, to wonder, is to begin to understand.
But the universe is infinite.
To be perfect she lacked just one defect.
ko: 그녀는 완벽하기 위해 딱 하나의 결점이 부족했어.

en: And yet, the contrary is always true as well.
ko: 그런데도 그 반대 역시 항상 사실이야.

en: We don't see things as they are, but as we are.
ko: 우리는 사물을 있는 그대로 보는 게 아니라 우리 방식대로 봐.

en: The world is a den of crazies.
You found me where no one else was looking.
ko: 아무도 안 찾는 곳에서 네가 나를 찾아냈어.

en: You're by my side; everything's fine now.
ko: 네가 내 옆에 있으니까 이제 다 괜찮아.

en: What do you mean you don't know?!
You look stupid.
I think I'm gonna go to sleep.
My name is Jack.
I like it very much.
We're meeting up tomorrow?
How do you say that in Italian?
I have to go shopping. I'll be back in an hour.
ko: 장 보러 가야 돼. 한 시간 뒤에 올게.

en: Is it far from here?
These things aren't mine!
Thanks, that's all.
Would you like to dance with me?
Italy is a very beautiful country.
It's not my fault!
I'd like to stay for one night.
Could you dial for me? The telephone is too high.
ko: 번호 좀 눌러줄래? 전화기가 너무 높이 있어.

en: Is there a youth hostel near here?
Where are the showers?
Open your mouth!
Is it bad?
I have lost my wallet.
Love is never wasted.
Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
ko: 인생은 우리가 다른 계획을 세우느라 바쁠 때 일어나는 거야.

en: Not wanting is the same as having.
ko: 원하지 않는 건 가진 거나 마찬가지야.

en: He's very sexy.
"Pass me the salt, please." "Here you are."
There are too many things to do!
Come on, play with me, I'm so bored!
ko: 아 좀, 나랑 놀아줘, 너무 심심해!

en: Don't you even think of eating my chocolate!
ko: 내 초콜릿 먹을 생각도 하지 마!

en: Stop asking me for a drink! Go get it yourself.
ko: 마실 것 좀 달라고 그만 좀 해! 직접 가져다 마셔.

en: Thanks to you I've lost my appetite.
I really need to hit somebody.
ko: 진짜 누구 한 대 때리고 싶다.

en: Who doesn't know this problem?!
It has been so long since I last went to Disneyland with my family.
ko: 가족이랑 디즈니랜드 간 지 진짜 오래됐다.

en: My parents keep arguing about stupid things. It's so annoying!
ko: 우리 부모님은 맨날 별것도 아닌 일로 싸우셔. 진짜 짜증 나!

en: If you don't want to put on sunscreen, that's your problem. Just don't come complaining to me when you get a sunburn.
ko: 선크림 바르기 싫으면 말든가. 나중에 살 타서 따갑다고 나한테 징징대지만 마.

en: My friends always say I'm too calm, but my family always says I'm too annoying.
ko: 친구들은 내가 너무 차분하다는데, 가족들은 내가 너무 시끄럽대.

en: I hate those spiders. They're always there to freak me out when I'm cleaning.
ko: 거미 진짜 싫어. 청소할 때마다 나타나서 사람 놀라게 한다니까.

en: So annoying... Now I get a headache whenever I use the computer!
ko: 짜증 나... 이제 컴퓨터만 하면 머리가 아파!

en: It's so hot that you could cook an egg on the hood of a car.
ko: 너무 더워서 자동차 보닛 위에서 계란도 익겠어.

en: It is very hot today.
Nobody came.
Better to be hated for who you are than loved for who you're not.
ko: 거짓된 모습으로 사랑받기보다 있는 그대로의 모습으로 미움받는 게 나아.

en: It's lonely in the saddle since the horse died.
ko: 말이 죽고 나니 안장 위가 쓸쓸하네.

en: My eyes are an ocean in which my dreams are reflected.
Look at me when I talk to you!
What would the world be without women?
What if you gave a speech and nobody came?
I don't know what to say to make you feel better.
ko: 무슨 말을 해야 네 기분이 풀릴지 모르겠어.

en: This is not my type.
I was trying to kill time.
How did you come up with this crazy idea?
ko: 이런 말도 안 되는 생각은 어떻게 한 거야?

en: I'm tired.
Who wants some hot chocolate?
Speak more slowly, please!
When do we arrive?
The check, please.
And what are we going to do?
I have a headache.
Where can one make a phone call?
I must admit that I snore.
Tonight we're going to church.
How are you? Did you have a good trip?
I don't feel well.
Call the police!
It's too expensive!
She's faking sleep. That's why she's not snoring.
ko: 쟤 자는 척하는 거야. 그래서 코 안 고는 거야.

en: My shoes are too small. I need new ones.
ko: 신발이 너무 작아. 새 거 필요해.

en: We're getting out of here. The cops are coming.
Merry Christmas!
It would be so cool if I could speak ten languages!
ko: 10개 국어 할 수 있으면 진짜 멋지겠다!

en: "If you're tired, why don't you go to sleep?" "Because if I go to sleep now I will wake up too early."
ko: "피곤하면 좀 자지 그래?" "지금 자면 너무 일찍 깰 것 같아서."

en: You should have listened to me.
It's a complete mess, and it's getting on my nerves.
When the body is touched, receptors in the skin send messages to the brain causing the release of chemicals such as endorphins.
ko: 몸에 손이 닿으면 피부의 수용체가 뇌에 신호를 보내서 엔도르핀 같은 물질이 나오게 해.

en: One hundred and fifty thousand couples are expected to get married in Shanghai in 2006.
Half a million children still face malnutrition in Niger.
ko: 니제르에서는 아직도 어린이 50만 명이 영양실조를 겪고 있어.

en: Bicycles are tools for urban sustainability.
ko: 자전거는 도시 지속 가능성을 위한 도구야.

en: The French government has launched an online game that challenges taxpayers to balance the national budget.
ko: 프랑스 정부가 납세자들이 국가 예산을 짜보는 온라인 게임을 만들었대.

en: He would be glad to hear that.
What do you believe is true even though you cannot prove it?
ko: 증명할 수는 없지만 사실이라고 믿는 게 뭐야?

en: Computers make people stupid.
Don't ask what they think. Ask what they do.
ko: 그들이 뭘 생각하는지 묻지 말고, 뭘 하는지를 물어봐.

en: When you're trying to prove something, it helps to know it's true.
ko: 뭔가를 증명하려 할 때는 그게 사실이라는 걸 아는 게 도움이 돼.

en: What changes the world is communication, not information.
ko: 세상을 바꾸는 건 정보가 아니라 소통이야.

en: Most scientific breakthroughs are nothing else than the discovery of the obvious.
ko: 대부분의 과학적 돌파구는 그저 당연한 걸 발견한 것뿐이야.

en: If you don't understand something, it's because you aren't aware of its context.
ko: 뭔가를 이해 못 한다면 그건 맥락을 몰라서 그래.

en: The past can only be known, not changed. The future can only be changed, not known.
ko: 과거는 알 수는 있지만 바꿀 수 없고, 미래는 바꿀 수는 있지만 알 수는 없어.

en: The key question is not what can I gain but what do I have to lose.
ko: 중요한 건 내가 뭘 얻을지가 아니라 뭘 잃을지야.

en: Anything that can be misunderstood will be.
ko: 오해받을 만한 건 결국 오해받게 돼 있어.

en: Why is life so full of suffering?
Despite the importance of sleep, its purpose is a mystery.
ko: 잠이 중요하긴 한데, 왜 자야 하는지는 여전히 수수께끼야.

en: Passion creates suffering.
The train from Geneva will arrive at the station.
ko: 제네바에서 오는 기차가 곧 역에 도착할 거야.

en: I would like to give him a present for his birthday.
ko: 걔 생일 선물로 뭐 하나 주고 싶어.

en: I'm starving!
Do you have friends in Antigua?
A cubic meter corresponds to 1000 liters.
I have so much work that I will stay for one more hour.
ko: 할 일이 너무 많아서 한 시간 더 있다 갈게.

en: I am married and have two children.
He plays the piano very well.
I see it rarely.
I'd like to study in Paris.
You don't know who I am.
Why don't you eat vegetables?
Why do people go to the movies?
ko: 사람들은 왜 영화 보러 가는 걸까?

en: I'm undressing.
The car crashed into the wall.
In a dictionary like this one there should be at least two sentences with "fridge".
ko: 이런 사전에는 '냉장고'라는 단어가 들어간 문장이 적어도 두 개는 있어야 해.

en: The wind calmed down.
Give me time to give you everything I have!
ko: 내가 가진 모든 걸 줄 수 있게 시간을 좀 줘!

en: A democrat is a free citizen who yields to the will of the majority.
ko: 민주주의자는 다수의 뜻에 따르는 자유 시민이야.

en: Where there's a will, there's a way.
Who searches, finds.
Rome wasn't built in a day.
Silence gives consent.
ko: "다 끝냈어?" "아니, 오히려 아직 시작도 안 했어."

en: "Good morning", said Tom with a smile.
Why does one say "Good day" when the day is not good?
ko: 별로인 날에 왜 "좋은 하루"라고 하는 거야?

en: Wine is poetry filled in bottles.
That was the best day of my life.
I don't understand German.
I made my decision.
I give you my word.
We have a Pope.
There are 10 types of people in the world: those who understand binary, and those who don't.
ko: 세상에는 10종류의 사람이 있어. 이진법을 이해하는 사람과, 못 하는 사람.

en: Don't worry, be happy!
I find foreign languages very interesting.
I don't like learning irregular verbs.
ko: 불규칙 동사 배우는 거 진짜 싫어.

en: Take a book and read it.
You make me dream.
I'm beside myself with joy.
The vacation is over now.
I'm afraid to fall.
That's the absolute truth.
It's cold.
I'm thirsty.
When I ask people what they regret most about high school, they nearly all say the same thing: that they wasted so much time.
ko: 사람들한테 고등학교 때 뭐가 제일 후회되냐고 물어보면, 거의 다 똑같이 말해. 시간을 너무 낭비했다는 거지.

en: When you can't do what you want, you do what you can.
ko: 하고 싶은 걸 할 수 없을 때는, 할 수 있는 걸 하는 거야.

en: Give him an inch and he'll take a yard.
ko: 하나를 주면 열을 달라고 할 거야.

en: You did this intentionally!
You didn't tell him anything?
ko: 그 사람한테 아무 말도 안 했어?

en: You're my type.
You're irresistible.
ko: 넌 거부할 수 없는 매력이 있어.

en: Could you call again later, please?
Who am I talking with?
Smile now, cry later!
At the age of six he had learned to use the typewriter and told the teacher that he did not need to learn to write by hand.
ko: 그는 여섯 살 때 타자기 사용법을 배워서, 선생님한테 손글씨는 배울 필요 없다고 말했어.

en: Life is beautiful.
He doesn't want you to tell him about your sex life.
ko: 그는 네 성생활 얘기를 듣고 싶어 하지 않아.

en: Have you ever eaten a banana pie?
Why would you marry a woman if you like men?
ko: 남자를 좋아하면서 왜 여자랑 결혼하려는 거야?

en: Are you for or against abortions?
What made you change your mind?
It's a pity that you can't buy miracles like you would buy potatoes.
ko: 기적을 감자 사듯이 살 수 없다는 게 참 아쉽네.

en: I love lasagna.
This baby penguin is too cute!
I'm at the hospital. I got struck by lightning.
What is your greatest source of inspiration?
You don't marry someone you can live with — you marry the person whom you cannot live without.
ko: 같이 살 수 있는 사람과 결혼하는 게 아니라, 없으면 살 수 없는 사람과 결혼하는 거야.

en: In theory, there is no difference between theory and practice. But, in practice, there is.
ko: 이론적으로는 이론과 실제의 차이가 없지만, 실제로는 차이가 있어.

en: Don't stay in bed, unless you can make money in bed.
ko: 침대에서 돈 벌 수 있는 게 아니면 누워만 있지 마.

en: Anything that is too stupid to be spoken is sung.
ko: 말로 하기엔 너무 멍청한 것들은 노래가 돼.

en: It requires wisdom to understand wisdom: the music is nothing if the audience is deaf.
ko: 지혜를 이해하려면 지혜가 필요해. 청중이 듣지 못하면 음악은 아무 의미 없거든.

en: I was rereading the letters you sent to me.
ko: 네가 나한테 보낸 편지들 다시 읽고 있었어.

en: I don't want to go to school.
It's over between us. Give me back my ring!
ko: 우리 이제 끝이야. 내 반지 돌려줘!

en: It is raining.
I was planning on going to the beach today, but then it started to rain.
ko: 오늘 바다 가려고 했는데 비가 오네.

en: She's really smart, isn't she?
Justice is expensive.
Liberty consists of being able to make everything as harmless as possible.
ko: 자유라는 건 모든 걸 최대한 해롭지 않게 만드는 데 있어.

en: Every opinion is a mixture of truth and mistakes.
ko: 모든 의견은 진실과 실수가 섞여 있어.

en: Life is a fatal sexually transmitted disease.
If two men always have the same opinion, one of them is unnecessary.
ko: 두 사람이 늘 같은 의견이라면, 그중 한 명은 필요 없는 사람이야.

en: Our opinion is an idea which we have; our conviction an idea which has us.
ko: 의견은 우리가 가진 생각이지만, 신념은 우리를 지배하는 생각이야.

en: Tomorrow, I'm going to study at the library.
Too late.
I went to the zoo yesterday.
We won the battle.
Hello? Are you still here?
I make lunch every day.
I watched TV this morning.
I read a book while eating.
I slept a little during lunch break because I was so tired.
I started learning Chinese last week.
I live near the sea so I often get to go to the beach.
ko: 바다 근처에 살아서 바다에 자주 가.

en: Someday I will buy a cotton candy machine.
It's practical to have a laptop.
Your glasses fell on the floor.
How many times a day do you look at yourself in the mirror?
We went to London last year.
She doesn't want to talk about it.
I lost my inspiration.
Be patient please. It takes time.
Close the door when you leave.
This is such a sad story.
My little brother is watching TV.
ko: 내 남동생 지금 TV 보고 있어.

en: Denying she was an anarchist, Katja maintained she wished only to make changes in our government, not to destroy it.
ko: 카티야는 자기가 아나키스트라는 걸 부정하면서, 정부를 파괴하려는 게 아니라 단지 변화시키고 싶을 뿐이라고 주장했어.

en: You met him at the university?
Aaah!! My computer is broken!
Yes, it happens from time to time.
People in the world are always advocating for more freedom and equality.
ko: 세상 사람들은 항상 더 많은 자유와 평등을 주장해.

en: He was sick of being vilified all the time by people who were jealous of his ability.
ko: 걔는 자기 실력을 질투하는 사람들한테 맨날 비난받는 거에 진저리가 났어.

en: Even people who don't believe in the Catholic church venerate the Pope as a symbolic leader.
ko: 가톨릭 신자가 아닌 사람들도 교황을 상징적인 지도자로 존경해.

en: As the plane was approaching turbulence, the pilot asked the passengers aboard the plane to fasten their seat belts.
ko: 비행기가 난기류에 진입하니까 기장이 승객들한테 안전벨트 매달라고 했어.

en: Jason was a taciturn individual, so it was always a real surprise when he said anything.
ko: 제이슨은 워낙 말수가 적은 애라서, 무슨 말이라도 하면 진짜 놀라웠어.

en: The king was tired of his sycophants always praising him, so he sent them away.
ko: 왕은 아첨꾼들이 맨날 찬양하는 게 지겨워서 그들을 멀리 보냈어.

en: Spenser would not tell anyone his surreptitious plan to get back at his friends for pranking him.
ko: 스펜서는 친구들이 자기한테 장난친 거 복수하려고 세운 비밀 계획을 아무한테도 말하지 않았어.

en: If Spenser doesn't keep adding and translating sentences, the other contributors will surely surpass him.
ko: 스펜서가 문장을 계속 추가하고 번역하지 않으면, 다른 기여자들한테 분명히 추월당할 거야.

en: His essay gave only a superficial analysis of the problem, so it was a real surprise to him when he got the highest grade in the class.
